intro: Rhodiola dielsiana, commonly known as the Tibetan rhodiola, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Asia. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to survive in harsh mountainous conditions. It is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes at elevations above 3,000 meters. Rhodiola dielsiana is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional Chinese and Tibetan medicine.
